'''EMC Atmos''' is a [[cloud storage]] services platform developed by [[EMC Corporation]]. Atmos can be deployed as either a hardware appliance<ref>Atmos hardware specification sheet: http://www.emc.com/collateral/software/specification-sheet/h5853-atmos-stor-hrdw-ss.pdf</ref> or as software in a virtual environment.<ref>Atmos Virtual Edition data sheet: http://www.emc.com/collateral/software/data-sheet/h7295-atmos-virt-ed-ds.pdf</ref> The Atmos technology is designed to manage petabytes of information and billions of objects across multiple geographic locations as a single system. <ref>Brodkin, Jon. [http://www.infoworld.com/d/cloud-computing/emc-unveils-atmos-cloud-offering-771 EMC unveils Atmos cloud offering] Infoworld</ref><ref>Lawson, Stephen. [http://www.infoworld.com/d/data-explosion/emcs-atmos-cloud-storage-gains-more-efficient-data-protection-551 EMC's Atmos cloud storage gains more efficient data protection] InfoWorld</ref>
Atmos can be used as data storage for custom or packaged applications using either a [[REST]] or [[SOAP]] data [[API]], or more traditional storage interfaces like [[Network File System|NFS]] and [[CIFS]]. It presents a single unified namespace or object-space, stores information as objects (files + [[metadata]]), and manages information by user or administrator-defined policies.<ref>Brodkin, Jon. [http://www.infoworld.com/d/cloud-computing/emc-unveils-atmos-cloud-offering-771 EMC unveils Atmos cloud offering] Infoworld</ref>
==History== Atmos was organically developed by EMC Corporation and was made generally available in November 2008.<ref>EMC Corporation News Release: http://www.emc.com/about/news/press/2008/20081110-01.htm</ref> A second major release in February 2010 added a "GeoProtect" distributed data protection feature, faster processors and denser hard drives.<ref>Mellor, Chris. [http://www.theregister.co.uk/2010/02/16/emc_atmos_upgrade/ EMC adds awesome to Atmos] The Register</ref>
During EMC World in May 2011, EMC announced the 2.0 version of Atmos with better performance, more efficient "GeoParity" data protection and expanded access with Windows client software (Atmos GeoDrive) and an Atmos [[Software development kit|SDK]] with Centera/[[XAM]] and Apple iOS compatibility.<ref>Mosher, Barb. [http://www.cmswire.com/cms/enterprise-cms/emc-announces-cloud-storage-updates-hadoop-based-bi-softwareemcworld-011193.php EMC Announces Cloud Storage Updates, Hadoop based BI Software#emcworld] CMS Wire</ref>
